summary: This is an email chain regarding scheduling for the arraignment and presentment of Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019, in the Southern District of New York. It specifies two court proceedings in different courtrooms with different judges presiding.

persons.name: Zachary Stem
persons.context: Sent the original email detailing the schedule for the two court proceedings for USA v. Epstein on July 8, 2019.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Presided over the first proceeding in courtroom 238 of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse on the morning of July 8, 2019.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Presided over the second proceeding in courtroom 178 of the Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse on July 8, 2019.

events.title: Epstein Arraignment and Presentment Proceedings
events.description: Two court proceedings for USA v. Epstein: a morning presentment/arraignment before Magistrate Judge Henry B. Pitman, followed by a proceeding before District Judge Richard M. Berman.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan Courthouse, courtrooms 238 and 178
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's federal criminal case (19-cr-490) had its initial court proceedings on July 8, 2019.
The proceedings involved two separate hearings before two different judges: Magistrate Judge Henry B. Pitman and District Judge Richard M. Berman.
The email confirms the high-profile and procedurally significant nature of Epstein's arrest and initial court appearance in the SDNY.
